item.title: Windows Core Processes
item.description: There are two broad categories of Windows core processes. Processes that initialize system environment and those that initialize the user environment. Whatever is the category, you need to know them well in order to detect abnormal things.

item.title: Windows Hibernation
item.description: Hibernation files store the last state of RAM before “falling asleep” ðŸ’¤ . These files are of a particular value when live acquisition is impossible.

item.title: Windows LSA
item.description: SID Below is the structure of a SID. SID, shortly speaking, is a user id. The actual ID of the user, is the RID (relative identifier) part.
